trans-unit.source: Represents a parameter to an <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommand"></xref> and optionally its mapping to a <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref>.
This class cannot be inherited.
Parameter names are not case-sensitive.

When querying an Oracle database using the Microsoft OLE DB Provider for Oracle (MSDAORA) and the ODBC.NET Framework Data Provider, using the `LIKE` clause to query values in fixed-length fields may not return all expected matches.
The reason is that when Oracle matches values for fixed-length fields in a `LIKE` clause, it matches the entire length of the string, including any padding trailing spaces.

For example, if a table in an Oracle database contains a field named "Field1" that is defined as `char(3)`, and you enter the value "a" into a row of that table, the following code will not return the row.

This is because Oracle stores the column value as "a " (padding "a", with trailing spaces, to the fixed field length of 3), which Oracle does not treat as a match for the parameter value of "a" in the case of a `LIKE` comparison of fixed-length fields.
To resolve this problem, append a percentage ("%") wildcard character to the parameter value (`"a%"`), or use an SQL `=` comparison instead.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> class that uses the parameter name and data type.
The name of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> values.
The value supplied in the oracleType parameter is an invalid back-end data type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> class that uses the parameter name and an <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> object.
When you specify an <xref:System.Object> in the `value` parameter, the <xref:System.Data.DbType> is inferred from the Microsoft .NET Framework type of the <xref:System.Object>.
Use caution when you are using this overload of the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> constructor.

Because this overload takes a `value` of type <xref:System.Object>, you must convert the integral value to an <xref:System.Object> type when the value is zero, as the following Microsoft Visual C# example demonstrates.
If you do not perform this conversion, the compiler will assume that you are trying to call the `OracleParameter`(`string`, `OracleType`) constructor overload.
The name of the parameter.
An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> class that uses the parameter name, data type, and length.
The name of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> values.
The length of the parameter.
The value supplied in the oracleType parameter is an invalid back-end data type.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> class that uses the parameter name, data type, length, and source column name.
The name of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> values.
The length of the parameter.
The name of the source column.
The value supplied in the oracleType parameter is an invalid back-end data type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> class that uses the parameter name, data type, size, direction, source column, source version, and other properties.
The name of the parameter to map.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> values.
The length of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.ParameterDirection"></xref> values.
The name of the source column.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowVersion"></xref> values.
`true` if the source column is nullable, otherwise `false`.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that is the value of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref>.
The value supplied in the oracleType parameter is an invalid back-end data type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref> class that uses the parameter name, data type, length, source column name, parameter direction, numeric precision, and other properties.
The name of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> values.
The length of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.ParameterDirection"></xref> values.
`true` if the value of the field can be null, otherwise, `false`.
The total number of digits to the left and right of the decimal point to which <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref> is resolved.
The total number of decimal places to which <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref> is resolved.
The name of the source column.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowVersion"></xref> values.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that is the value of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref>.
The value supplied in the oracleType parameter is an invalid back-end data type.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> of the parameter.
The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A> and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A> are linked.

Therefore, setting the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A> changes the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A> to a supporting <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A>.

The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A>, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A>, and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> properties of a parameter can be inferred by setting <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.
Therefore, you are not required to specify them.
However, they are not exposed in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> property settings.
For example, if the size of the parameter has been inferred, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> does not contain inferred value after statement execution.
For `String` data types the default is <xref:System.Data.DbType.AnsiString>.
For a list of the supported data types, see the appropriate <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A> member.
For more information, see [DataAdapter Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataadapter-parameters.md).
One of the <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Data.DbType.AnsiString"></xref>.
The property was not set to a valid <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the parameter is input-only, output-only, bidirectional, or a stored procedure return value parameter.

If the <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection> is output, and execution of the associated <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommand> does not return a value, the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> contains a null value.

`Output`, `InputOut`, and `ReturnValue` parameters returned by calling <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommand.ExecuteReader%2A> cannot be accessed until you call <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataReader.Close%2A> on the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataReader>.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.ParameterDirection"></xref> values.
The default is `Input`.
The property was not set to one of the valid <xref href="System.Data.ParameterDirection"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the parameter accepts null values.
Null values are handled using the <xref:System.DBNull> class.
`true` if null values are accepted, otherwise `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the offset to the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref> property.
The `Offset` property is used for client-side chunking of binary and string data.
For example, in order to insert 10MB of text into a column on a server, a user might execute 10 parameterized inserts of 1MB chunks, shifting the value of `Offset` on each iteration by 1MB.
`Offset` specifies the number of bytes for binary types, and the number of characters for strings.
The count for strings does not include the terminating character.
The offset to the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref>.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> of the parameter.
The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A> and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A> are linked.

Therefore, setting the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A> changes the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A> to a supporting <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType>.

The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A>, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A>, and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> properties of a parameter can be inferred by setting <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.
Therefore, you are not required to specify them.
However, they are not exposed in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> property settings.
For example, if the size of the parameter has been inferred, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> does not contain inferred value after statement execution.
For `String` data types the default is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType.VarChar>.
For a list of the supported data types, see the appropriate <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType> member.
For more information, see [DataAdapter Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataadapter-parameters.md).
An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> value that is the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType"></xref> of the parameter.
The default is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType.VarChar"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref>.
The .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle does not support positional parameters that are marked with a question mark (?).
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref>.
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets the maximum number of digits used to represent the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref> property.
Setting the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Precision%2A> or <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Scale%2A> properties has no effect.
The maximum number of digits used to represent the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref> property.
The default value is 0, which indicates that the data provider sets the precision for <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref>.
Resets the type associated with this <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref>.
When executing a command that includes parameter values, code can either set the type of a parameter explicitly, or the parameter can infer its type from its value.
Calling this method resets the parameter so that it can again infer its type from the value passed in the parameter.

Calling this method affects both the <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameter.DbType%2A> and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter>.
Resets the type associated with this <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter"></xref>.
When executing a command that includes parameter values, code can either set the type of a parameter explicitly, or the parameter can infer its type from its value.
Calling this method resets the parameter so that it can again infer its type from the value passed in the parameter.

Calling this method affects both the <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameter.DbType%2A> and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter>.
Gets or sets the number of decimal places to which <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref> is resolved.
Setting the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Precision%2A> or <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Scale%2A> properties has no effect.
The number of decimal places to which <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref> is resolved.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, of the data within the column.
Setting <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> affects only the input value of a parameter.
Return values and output parameters are not affected by this property.
The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> property is used for binary and string types.
For nonstring data types and ANSI string data, the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> property refers to the number of bytes.
For Unicode string data, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> refers to the number of characters.
The count for strings does not include the terminating character.
For variable-length data types, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> describes the maximum amount of data to transmit to the server.
For example, for a Unicode string value, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> could be used to limit the amount of data sent to the server to the first one hundred characters.
For bidirectional and output parameters, and return values, you must set the value of Size.
This is not required for input parameters, and if not explicitly set, the value of is inferred from the actual size of the specified parameter when a parameterized statement is executed.

The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A>, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A>, and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> properties of a parameter can be inferred by setting <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.
Therefore, you are not required to specify them.
However, they are not exposed in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> property settings.
For example, if the size of the parameter has been inferred, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> does not contain inferred value after statement execution.
For fixed length data types, the value of <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> is ignored.
It can be retrieved for informational purposes, and returns the maximum amount of bytes the provider uses when transmitting the value of the parameter to the server.
The maximum size, in bytes, of the data within the column.
The default value is 0 (to be used when you do not want to specify the maximum size of the value).

Gets or sets the name of the source column mapped to the <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> and used for loading or returning the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref>

The link between the value of the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> and the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> may be bidirectional depending on the value of the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Direction%2A> property.
The name of the source column mapped to the <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
The default is an empty string ("").
Sets or gets a value which indicates whether the source column is nullable.
This allows <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommandBuilder"></xref> to correctly generate Update statements for nullable columns.

<xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.SourceColumnNullMapping%2A> is used by the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommandBuilder> to correctly generate update commands when dealing with nullable columns.
Generally, use of <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.SourceColumnNullMapping%2A> is limited to developers inheriting from <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommandBuilder>.
<xref:System.Data.Common.DbCommandBuilder> uses this property to determine whether the source column is nullable, and sets this property to `true` if it is nullable, and `false` if it is not.

When <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommandBuilder> is generating its Update statement, it examines the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.SourceColumnNullMapping%2A> for each parameter.
If the property is `true`, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommandBuilder> generates a WHERE clauses like the following (in this query expression, "FieldName" represents the name of the field):
If <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.SourceColumnNullMapping%2A> for the field is false, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommandBuilder> generates the following WHERE clause:
In addition, @IsNull_FieldName contains 1 if the source field contains null, and 0 if it does not.
This mechanism allows for a performance optimization in Oracle Server, and provides for common code that works across multiple providers.
`True` if the source column is nullable, otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowVersion"></xref> to use when you load <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value"></xref>.

This property is used by the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataAdapter.UpdateCommand%2A> during the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbDataAdapter.Update%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to determine whether the original or current value is used for a parameter value.
This lets primary keys be updated.

This property is set to the version of the <xref:System.Data.DataRow> used by the <xref:System.Data.DataRow.Item%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property (<xref:System.Data.DataRow> indexer), or the <xref:System.Data.DataRow.GetChildRows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method of the <xref:System.Data.DataRow> object.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.DataRowVersion"></xref> values.
The default is `Current`.
Gets a string that contains the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.ParameterName"></xref>.
A string that contains the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.ParameterName"></xref>.
Gets or sets the value of the parameter.
For input parameters, the value is bound to the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommand> that is sent to the server.
For output and return-value parameters, the value is set on completion of the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleCommand> and after the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataReader> is closed.

For an input parameter, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A> can be set to an object of either a Microsoft .NET Framework data type or an Oracle data type (for example, an <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleNumber> or <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleString>).
When you send a null parameter value to the server, you must specify DBNull, not null.
A null value in the system is an empty object that has no value.
DBNull is used to represent null values.
If the application specifies the database type, the bound value is converted to that type when the provider sends the data to the server.
The provider tries to convert any type of value if it supports the <xref:System.IConvertible> interface.
Conversion errors may result if the specified type is not compatible with the value.

The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.DbType%2A>, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.OracleType%2A>, and <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Size%2A> properties of a parameter can be inferred by setting Value.
Therefore, you are not required to specify them.
However, they are not exposed in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> property settings.
For example, if the size of the parameter has been inferred, Size does not contain inferred value after statement execution.

The `InputOutput`, `Output`, and `ReturnValue`<xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection> values used by the Value property will be Microsoft .NET Framework data types, unless the input value was an Oracle data type (for example, <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleNumber> or <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleString>).
This does not apply to REF CURSOR, BFILE, or LOB data types.
The <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A> property is overwritten by the **Update** method.
An object that is the value of the parameter.
The default value is null.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ICloneable.Clone"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ICloneable> interface.
A new object that is a copy of this instance.
